intro: Canariothamnus palmensis, commonly known as the Canary Islands thamnus, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in coastal and rocky habitats, adapting to the arid and saline conditions of its environment. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small yellow flowers that bloom in spring. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
